titleStmt.title: A sad and lamentable account of a barbarous and bloody-murther, committed upon the body of Sir William Hescot, Knight. At the Globe Tavern in Fleet-Street on the 14th of November 1684. For which Henry St. Johns Esq; and Colonel Web, stand committed to the county goal of Newgate. Containing the material circumstances, relating to the death of the said unfortunate gentleman.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
